decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponents' spells, removing threats from the board, and drawing cards to maintain advantage. It utilizes Ertai Resurrected as the commander, with a variety of counterspells such as Counterspell, Cryptic Command, and Force of Will to disrupt opponents' strategies. Removal spells like Fatal Push, Eliminate, and Toxic Deluge help deal with threats efficiently. The deck also includes card draw spells like Brainstorm, Fact or Fiction, and Memory Deluge to ensure a steady stream of resources. With a combination of control elements, card advantage, and powerful creatures like Torrential Gearhulk, the deck aims to outvalue opponents and control the game until securing victory.

This deck is focused on controlling the game by disrupting opponents' strategies with a variety of counter spells and removal spells. The commander, Davros, Dalek Creator, provides additional resource advantage and control options. The deck includes a wide range of counterspells like Force of Will and Mana Leak, along with removal spells such as Fatal Push and Toxic Deluge. It also features card advantage tools like Brainstorm and Preordain to help maintain a strong hand. Additionally, the deck includes powerful creatures like Baleful Strix and True-Name Nemesis to apply pressure while controlling the game. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the control strategy with a mix of dual lands and fetch lands.

The primary focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, leveraging the abilities of Judith, the Scourge Diva to enhance the damage output of your creatures. By using low-cost creatures like Goblin Guide, Dread Wanderer, and Knight of the Ebon Legion, along with efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. Additionally, cards like Claim the Firstborn and Goblin Bombardment provide extra ways to disrupt the opponent's strategy and push through damage. With a mix of creatures, burn spells, and disruptive elements, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and force the opponent onto the back foot.

The deck revolves around utilizing Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger as a control commander in a Duel Commander 1 vs 1 format. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt, and disruptive creatures like Dauthi Voidwalker and Nighthawk Scavenger. The deck also includes graveyard recursion with cards like Reanimate and Necromancy to bring back threats like Dragonknight or Scrapwork Mutt. Additionally, there are disruption tools like Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon to hinder the opponent's mana base. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outcontrol the opponent while slowly grinding them down with Kroxa's abilities.

The key concept of this deck is to assemble different combos involving reanimation spells, sacrifice effects, and powerful creatures to control the game and overwhelm the opponent in a 1 vs 1 Duel Commander format. Old Rutstein serves as the commander, providing a powerful engine for recurring creatures from the graveyard. The deck includes a variety of tutors, ramp spells, and disruptive cards to help set up the combo pieces and protect the game plan. By efficiently using resources and leveraging the graveyard, the deck aims to create a dominating board presence and ultimately win through a series of powerful combos and synergies.

The deck focuses on a strong graveyard recursion strategy with a heavy emphasis on combos and disruption. Old Stickfingers allows for powerful graveyard shenanigans, enabling the player to reanimate creatures or spells from the graveyard for explosive plays. The deck includes a variety of tutors and removal spells to control the board and find combo pieces efficiently. By utilizing cards like Dance of the Dead, Animate Dead, and Reanimate, the deck can quickly bring back key combo pieces or high-value creatures. Additionally, cards like Yawgmoth's Will and Dark Ritual provide additional mana acceleration to set up powerful plays. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue opponents through efficient combo plays and graveyard recursion.
